name: catachresis
text: The start of the legend.

name: ppccd
text:
The readers could sense there was something special about Roast Beef...
The Alt Text:
"People had been asking about the middle cat"

name: appers
text: I love how you can tell Onstad based Beef's entire personality on the fact he'd ignored him at first and guessed such an unimportant character would have a hell of an inferiority complex. And then he had such a time with that concept that Beef ended up the main character of the whole strip. He's not Ray, he's not Pat, but now he gets more screen time than both. Kinda ironic!

name: waddlerz
text: Not the start of a legend, the birth of a dynasty

name: centipede_damascus
text: I need to get the shirt based on this strip.

name: rapid_roy
text: I have it and it is legendary . This strip kicks so much ass.

name: thankfur
text: Hmm but why does Beef have sad eyebrows in the shirt? The neutral expression in the strip is far better.

name: rowboat
text: Essence of Beef.

name: deusoma
text: I realize it's like a year later, but it just occurred to me that "Essence of Beef" sounds like the manliest cologne ever.

name: greenkoolayd
text: or like, the broth in the pan, from making a roast.

name: mockereo
text:
Essence of Beef:

Deluxe gravy base

name: greenkoolayd
text:
Essence of Beef:

Deluxe Gravy Base/Aftershave lotion

name: carlyle
text: Essence of Beef: Part One of the All New Adult Series

name: soticoto
text: You mean the Essence of Beef I ... boned?!

name: foetus_punch
text:
My girlfriend got it for me. She got the Rabbit Ambulance for herself. And she got "The Dude is From Circumstances" for our mutual best friend. When we walk the streets, suckas now we is tight.

I considered burying it when I first got it, of course.

name: tekende
text: You are so ARROGANT!

name: omegatron
text: This is why I haven't bought an Achewood shirt. :(

name: zem
text: It is a good, simple rhyme

name: dougthehead
text: A good, simple rhyme that people can trust.

name: quantumcasaba
text: A good, simple rhyme that gets stuck in my head on occasion like such as a mantra or song.

name: erinye
text: I actually do always "hear" it as a stereotypical old-style sitcom theme-jingle.

name: gsurge
text:
It's beyond "hearing." You know it.

"There's Beef's jingle."
"I know Beef's jingle."

name: abe
text: beef i love you

name: jhunter
text:
beef i want to know you
as a man knows a lady

name: greenkoolayd
text: not that theres anything wrong with that.

name: mortshire
text: beef is somewhere else entirely in panel one.

name: jamers
text: I've forgotten my name in the heat of the moment too, Beef. Ain't no thang.

name: nutmeg
text:
i think his name just gives him depression here.

because it's not a real name.

name: fielding
text: A comment left by fielding was marked lame too many times and excluded. (marked lame by johnnybaverage, stopeatingmyeyes, envika, NinjaEin)

name: hellofditties
text: I think he just doesn't want to say "Cassandra."

name: zapatos
text: It is understandable, and strongly advised.

name: deusoma
text: Like viewer discretion.

name: belgand
text: I forgot Asia in the heat of the moment.

name: spanntastic
text: A comment left by spanntastic was marked lame too many times and excluded. (marked lame by NDCaesar, Zem, Boyd, yaegmenthor)

name: fuckyoufriday
text: I enjoy the ensemble aspect of achwood, but when you get down to it, it's all about the Beef. It's weird to remember how ancillary a character he was for so long.

name: deancain29
text: And a depressed legend is born.

name: djwhiterabbit
text:
ah, back in the smokin' years.

and to this day, the actual origin of 'roast beef' as a nickname has never been determined.

has it?

name: senseihollywood
text:
middle cat=middle toe

take off your socks and shoes and follow along...

ready? ahem...

this little piggy went to market
this little piggy stayed home
this little piggy had roast beef
this little piggy had none
and this little piggy went "wee wee wee..."

name: djwhiterabbit
text: OMFG.

name: nutmeg
text:
SECONDED!

mind BLOWWWNNNNNNN

name: cpnglxynchos
text:
THIRDED

WHOAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAA

name: closefriend
text: This is not only awesome for the obvious reason, but also because Roast Beef acts in accordance with ALL THREE middle toes.

name: straw
text: You have three middle toes?

name: closefriend
text: Neither first nor pinky.

name: straw
text: So, Ray is the first toe, Cornelius or Teodor is the second, Pat is the fourth (as he is a vegan), and the fifth is Phillipe because that is something Phillipe would do

name: donnatron
text: Not to mention Philippe is 5, which also corresponds.

name: fineoakstructure
text: Ah yes, I had the same epiphony about 1-2 yrs. ago while watching an Arrested Development episode where Ron Howard's narration at one point goes something like, "...the middle toe; you know, Roast Beef..." and it struck me: middle toe = Roast Beef = middle cat.  At the time I wondered if this was a sly reference on the writer's part to Achewood, but I doubt it.

name: steerpike66
text: It doesn't count if Ron Howard helped in any way. Sorry.

name: andrew_
text: OH SHIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIT!

name: nutmeg
text: man do you even KNOW how perfect the picture/text combo is here

name: werthog42
text: WOAH. This deserves a million chubbies.

name: tomsonlocal
text: I'm glad I know this, but also a little sad that the mystery has gone.

name: fielding
text: Are you sure the mystery has gone?

name: trollcollins
text:
MY MIND.

YOU BLEW IT.

I need a few minutes to catch my breath.

name: steerpike66
text: You just helped me ascend to the next astral plane. I can see to the ends of time. I can hear one hand clapping. I can smell blue.

name: vheissu
text: I like the both the word and the concept of synesthesia. Apparently this is possible, with drugs.

name: korukyu
text: holy crap. that was INTENSE.

name: quaga
text: I can't believe I never noticed this before

name: landowmpg
text: This is hell of brilliant.

name: a386
text: CHUBBIEST COMMENT ALIVE

name: achewoodno1fan
text: A comment left by achewoodno1fan was marked lame too many times and excluded. (marked lame by johnnybaverage, straw, ezcmac, silver_lake, twentyfivepast, Overmedicated, TheGrouch, Girdag, NDCaesar, luckypyjamas, m1st3rbl4ck, Audhumla, lastlarf, nilehus)

name: joestork
text: Whaaaaaaaaat?  chubby just for the whaaaaaaaaaat?

name: 1000hz
text: Onstad could have done anything with Beef right here, but I thank the heavens day after day that he chose to make him from Circumstances.

name: qatipay
text: man, Beef's legs get way less... drumsticky... as time goes on.

name: spectre
text: A comment left by spectre was marked lame too many times and excluded. (marked lame by nbgreene, ppccd, luasn)

name: cheeks_jd
text: The cats god damned name is Roast Beef. We are all used to it, but stop and actually think about it....

name: evolume
text: On a skateboard, to grab the board between your legs is to grab 'Roast Beef.'  True story.

name: fineoakstructure
text: the ugliest grab of them all

name: overmedicated
text: Isn't that a Sacktap? Equally vulgar, I know, but still.

name: dogjones
text: Roast beef is my favorite character

name: hrm
text: Likewise, he is mine

name: plezure
text: Humble origin strip.

name: dasilodavi
text: I don't think this strip is that funny.  I will however vote it 5 on sheer principle of introduction to my most favorite character in Achewood.

name: pa_ass_nts
text: This is not your father's Achewood.

name: snowman
text: Chubbied for your amazing name.  Nice going.

name: quarantine
text: Yessss, Beef is finally named!

name: heyman
text: We finally see our first facial hints of beef's depression

name: luckypyjamas
text: i just want to stop and point out ray's tongue in the last panel

name: fidelio-roo
text: Roast Beef * The Best

name: al_batross
text: If it wasn't a beautiful, beautiful 5, the perfect rating for this would be a 3.

name: kelsotimebomb
text: Hot damn, I wish I had my own logo.

name: nyu
text: Ray has gained some weight since these days.

name: fineoakstructure
text: Well, Ray did get a little chubby later in 2002

name: lrosetw8
text: He's married now!

name: hellofditties
text: You're right!

name: thedrizzle
text: He is between Ray and Pat, containing elements of both. Yet, somehow... the whole is greater than the sum of its parts.

name: shutup_shutup
text: Think maybe Brad Neely is a fan of Achewood? He did name a character in Wizard People Dear Reader "Roast Beefy-weefs".

name: spaceandrew
text: Roast Beef is my favorite character. The strips starring him and Ray are TRULY celebrations of the English language.

name: sonofkong
text: This is somewhat beautiful.

name: dtuba
text: The birth of Onstad's finest creation. So paralyzed by fear and self-doubt he cannot even verbally respond to Teodor in panel 2. That nod speaks volumes about Beef.

name: neo-aeris
text:
Roast Beef is clutching his shirt in panel seven! Oh my gosh, that says so much with so little and I didn't even see it the first dozen times I saw this strip!

Mr. Onstad! You are so great at drawing comics!!
